name: Peanuts (Unsalted, Dry-Roasted)
properties: Technically a legume, not a true nut
Rich in resveratrol, an antioxidant also found in grapes
Good source of vitamin E, niacin, folate, and magnesium
Choose unsalted, natural versions without added oils or sugars
benefits: Supports heart health through healthy fat profile
Provides sustained energy from protein and healthy fats
May help with satiety and weight management when portion-controlled
Supports muscle maintenance with plant protein
May help stabilize blood sugar levels
Adds richness and flavor to African-inspired stews
synergies: Combines with sweet potatoes in African peanut stew for balanced nutrition
Pairs with red kidney beans for complete protein profile
Works with ginger and cumin in savory dishes
Complements nigella seeds for texture contrast
conflicts: High in calories - use moderate portions (1/4 cup chopped peanuts)
Choose unsalted versions to avoid excess sodium
amount: 2 tablespoons natural peanut butter or 1/4 cup (30g) chopped unsalted dry-roasted peanuts per serving

quotes: 2 tablespoons smooth unsalted natural peanut butter
Place the peanut butter in a small bowl and blend in the remaining 1/4 cup/60ml of Light Vegetable Broth
